stories.text:
Case scenario: The main app would be used by company employees and I would provide a different app for managers so they can watch stats and employees info.

What is the best practice when developing such a SaaS? - Two separate apps for security purposes - Single app where features and UI are based on user's credentials

PS: The database would be shared in case I developed two different apps
stories.title: Ask HN: Developing a SaaS – Independent app for managers?
Building UI Components with SVG and CSS

stories.text:
Regarding open source projects, I think many open source projects are abandoned because development and revenue cannot be balanced. Some developers have very great ideas, but are limited by time and revenue issues.
Here is a decentralized application based on Ethereum: https://vorg.io.
Developer can start their own virtual organizations on it, and can obtain development funds through capital and share increase, and share trading. At the same time, VORG also provides domain name services. Each virtual organization (except for special names) has an exclusive permanent domain name.
Here's an article about vorg: https://medium.com/@vorg-npc/vorg-decentralized-company-and-domain-name-registrar-84f5b15c6224.
If you are interested, you can also join our telegram discussion group: https://t.me/+-GW1IgBPNq0zY2Nl
